subtitles.transcript: I think that it is a real trap for anybody to think that Berkeley is going to become a private university,
because it isn’t. First of all, it’s on public land. This extraordinary campus is a public property.
Secondly, even though state funding has been cut, it gets lots of money from the state,
so it’s hardly right to say that that’s trivial. It is a state university. It will always be a state university.
Anybody that says we’re going to privatize Berkeley because that’s the way forward is just, I think,
fundamentally mistaken about the constraints and conditions of its existence.
